RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added PublicationInfo. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: Contains estimated electron average energy (Eavg) and energy flux (Q) in the auroral oval. Data is available in both geomagnetic and geographic coordinates.

PublicationInfo.PublishedBy: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory

AccessURL.Name: GUVI POC L3 Data Products Data Request
AccessURL.Description: This web page allows the request of data files for this product. To request data: select the year and day then press display.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic north electron average energy
Parameter.Description: Estimated magnetic north electron average energy (Eavg)

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Max dat points,Number of orbits] - where Max dat points is the number of data points in the file, Number of orbits is the number of orbits in the orbital file.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic south electron average energy
Parameter.Description: Estimated magnetic south electron average energy (Eavg)

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Max dat points,Number of orbits] - where Max dat points is the number of data points in the file, Number of orbits is the number of orbits in the orbital file.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic north electron energy flux
Parameter.Description: Estimated magnetic north electron energy flux (Q)

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Max dat points,Number of orbits] - where Max dat points is the number of data points in the file, Number of orbits is the number of orbits in the orbital file.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic south electron energy flux
Parameter.Description: Estimated magnetic south electron energy flux (Q)

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Max dat points,Number of orbits] - where Max dat points is the number of data points in the file, Number of orbits is the number of orbits in the orbital file.
